articles.description: The week gone by saw a lot of happenings in tech town. The Indian Army cracked down on 89 apps as it banned its soldiers from using them. Instagram is looking to fill the TikTok ‘void’ by launching its Reels feature whereas Dell announced its new range of pre…
articles.content: Citing security considerations and leakage of sensitive data, the Indian Army has directed all its officers and soldiers to delete 89 apps from their mobile phones. As per the directive issued, these… [+113 chars]

articles.title: Regret installing the iOS 14 or iPadOS 14 public beta? Go back to iOS 13 - CNET
articles.description: If there are just too many bugs or bad battery life is driving you crazy, you can leave the beta and go back to iOS 13 on your iPhone or iPad.
articles.content:
You'll need to put your iPhone or iPad in recovery mode to get rid of iOS 14. 
Jason Cipriani/CNET
